de.ovgu.featureide.fm.core.base.impl

Class AFeature

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.ovgu.featureide.fm.core.base.impl.AFeatureModelElement
      • de.ovgu.featureide.fm.core.base.impl.AFeature
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IEventManager, IFeature, IFeatureModelElement
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Feature

    public abstract class AFeature
extends AFeatureModelElement
implements IFeature
    FeatureIDE's default IFeature implementation as the starting point for user-defined implementations.

    This class implements the minimum functionality required for a IFeature class and further functionality from AFeatureModelElement. The first provides getter and setter of the feature's properties, custom properties, and the feature's structure (for more information, see IFeature documentation). The second implements FeatureIDE's internal functionality to identify a given feature inside a feature model, and to provide event listening capabilities with the listener/observer pattern.

    This class is intended to be a starting point for user-defined implementation, such that a subclass of AFeature only have to provide an implementation of IFeature.clone(IFeatureModel, IFeatureStructure). FeatureIDE provides a default non-abstract implementation Feature which extends AFeature in this sense.

    An instance of a subclass of AFeature is intended to be instantiated by a IFeatureModelFactory.

    Example
    The following example demonstrate the creation of a new feature called FeatureA using FeatureIDE's default AFeature implementation Feature, and the corresponding default factory DefaultFeatureModelFactory over the conviennent factory class FMFactoryManager. The instance is stored against the IFeature interface: IFeatureModel model = FMFactoryManager.getFactory().createFeatureModel(); IFeature feature = FMFactoryManager.getFactory().createFeature(model, "FeatureA"); A unified handling of certain AFeature (IFeature) implementations (in terms of conviennent methods) can be achieved with the use of FeatureUtils helper class.

    Notes on equals method: The AFeature implementation inherits the Object.equals(Object) capability from AFeatureModelElement. The feature equality is defined as the equality of the underlying internal identifiers per feature.

    Since:
    3.0
    Author:
    Sebastian Krieter, Marcus Pinnecke
    See Also:
    Interface for feature in FeatureIDE (IFeature), Interface for feature constraints (IConstraint), Interface for feature models (IFeatureModel), Interface for feature properties (IFeatureProperty), Interface for a feature's structure (IFeatureStructure), Default implementation for feature constraints (AConstraint), Default implementation for feature models (FeatureModel), Default implementation for feature properties (FeatureProperty), Default implementation for a feature's structure (FeatureStructure)

    • Constructor Detail

      • AFeature

        public AFeature(IFeatureModel featureModel,
                java.lang.String name)
        Default constructor. Constructs a new instance of AFeature with the name name in a given feature model featureModel. The parameter featureModel have to be non-null since features are identified by their internal numerical identifier and featureModel have to provide the next free identifier.
        Parameters:
        featureModel - in which the new instance feature should be part of
        name - the name of the feature.
        Since:
        3.0

    • Method Detail

      • getProperty

        public IFeatureProperty getProperty()
        Description copied from interface: IFeature
        Returns the feature's properties. These properties depend on the IFeatureProperty implementation, but contain at least getters and setters for
        • a custom-defined description of the feature
        • a string-representation of the feature which is intended for display purposes
        • information about the feature status (dead, false-optional,...)
        • the state of the feature's selection in the GUI
        For user-defined properties, the IFeatureProperty implementation must be changed, or the method IFeature.getCustomProperties() can be used.
        Specified by:
        getProperty in interface IFeature
        Returns:
        Implementation-specific feature properties.

      • getStructure

        public IFeatureStructure getStructure()
        Description copied from interface: IFeature
        Returns the feature structure, in which this feature lives in. The structure gives information about (and setter to) the children and the parent of this feature, and statement-related properties such as if this feature is part of an alternative group, or if it is abstract or hidden.

        Note: The returned object have to be non-null.
        Specified by:
        getStructure in interface IFeature
        Returns:
        The features structure properties.

      • getCustomProperties

        public IPropertyContainer getCustomProperties()
        Description copied from interface: IFeature
        Returns the feature's custom-defined properties. These properties can be get and set without changes to the code base, or the need for a custom IFeatureProperty implementation (see IFeature.getProperty()). Custom-Properties do map a Java primitive value to a string key and can stored to the file system.
        Specified by:
        getCustomProperties in interface IFeature
        Returns:
        Implementation-independent custom feature properties.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:

      • createTooltip

        public java.lang.String createTooltip(java.lang.Object... objects)
        Description copied from interface: IFeature
        Creates the tooltip for the feature. Used to have the same tooltip in the different views that are used within the project. The tooltip created for the feature depents on the parameter objects given to it.
        Specified by:
        createTooltip in interface IFeature
        Parameters:
        objects - Objects to determine which content should be generated.
        Returns:
        Tooltip content as string
